intro: Ruschia leucanthera, commonly known as the white-flowered ruschia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant features small, fleshy leaves that are typically green or blue-gray in color. Its flowers are small, star-shaped, and predominantly white or pale pink, appearing in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
